page.title: 08SHOPS
page.content: There are four shops in Chipping Warden The village shop and Post Office has been a shop for 25 years. The butchers has been a shop for 48 years. It is owned by Mr Davis. The hairdressers is owned by Mrs Davis and has been there for 17 years. The Pine Shop was at one time a woodyard and the local undertaker was Mr John Read. This belonged to the estate belonging to Lord North's family. All sorts of carpentry work was carried on in the yard. At this house fencing materials were made as well as being the centre for other building works. The shop was built about ten years ago with old bricks and was a craft shop. Mrs Shrimpton ran this for three years and she also sold stripped pine. She then moed the craft business to Milton Keynes. The Venning family now sell antique stripped pine furniture.
